page.title: 08Farming in Ripe
page.content: There are several sheep farmers in the area. Pig farming is also practiced but there are no chicken farms since one closed down due to economic reasons. The Sussex countryside is popular with horse breeders. Ripe has one stud and another farmer specialises in training horses to ride and drive. Arable farms are represented by Church Farm, Chalvington which grows vegetables and flowers. Most farmers use a rotation of crops with grass to improve the quality of the soil. This year has been a bad year for many farms as the Spring was wet and cold and the Summer was the same while Autumn, when seeds for Winter crops should have germinated, was too dry. Turfing is a good way of making a profit enabling the farmer to carry out draining or other farm improvement
